newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian banks asked to fix spread over prime rate.
newsitem.headline: Indian banks asked to fix spread over prime rate.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Saturday said banks should announce the maximum spread over the prime lending rate (PLR) for all advances other than consumer credit.
RBI said several banks are charging lending rates far higher than PLR on a significant portion of bank credit to borrowers with credit limits over 200,000 rupees.
"Credibility of the PLR is lost if the actual interest rates charged by the banks are sharply higher than the PLR."

"It has therefore been decided that banks, along with the announcement of their PLR, should also announce the maximum spread over the prime lending rate for all advances other than consumer credit," it said.
A separate communication will be sent to banks in this connection, RBI said in its monetary policy for 1996/97 (April-March).
